description: This course will use detailed case studies of the development of several historic and contemporary public spaces to illustrate and make available techniques for research on, and analysis of the spatial form, use and meaning of the public realm in cities. Students will apply these techniques to the exploration and analysis of public space in Singapore. Special attention will be given to the role of architecture, public art and civic ritual in shaping public space.
title: Public Space: Urbanism, Architecture and Public Art
